contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=August 2009}} '''Bill Fletcher''' is a [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] [[politician]] from the [[United States|U.S.]] state of [[North Carolina]]. Fletcher was the Republican nominee for [[North Carolina Superintendent of Public Instruction]] in the [[North Carolina Council of State election, 2004]]. The race between Fletcher and [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] candidate [[June Atkinson]] was nearly even; while a statewide recount was underway in November 2004, Fletcher and several other candidates filed [[lawsuit|suit]] against the [http://www.sboe.state.nc.us/ North Carolina Board of Elections], challenging that the counting of [[provisional ballots]] (mandated by the [[Help America Vote Act]]) was contrary to the Constitution of North Carolina. The [[North Carolina Democratic Party|Democratic-controlled]] [[North Carolina General Assembly]] decided the race (August 23, 2005) in favor of June Atkinson. It was the last 2005 state-wide race in the [[United States]] to be decided. Eleanor Goattee defeated Mr. Fletcher in November 2005; he was not reelected to the District 9 seat on the [[Wake County Public Schools|Wake County Board of Education]].<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.wcpss.net/Board/boeinfo.html |title=WCPSS: Board of Education Member Information |accessdate=2009-08-29 |author= |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date=October 9, 2004 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20041009200145/http://www.wcpss.net/Board/boeinfo.html |archivedate=2004-10-09 |publisher=[[Wake County Public Schools]] |quote=District 9 (Western Wake) Mr. Bill Fletcher ... Term Expires: November 2005}} </ref> It was a [[non-partisan]] [[general election|election]]. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ncdp.org/Atkinson_Calls_on_Fletcher_to_Concede Supt. of Public Instruction-elect Atkinson Calls on Fletcher to Concede, Files Notice with General Assembly to Decide Election] [[North Carolina Democratic Party]] *[http://www.aoc.state.nc.us/www/public/coa/opinions/2006/pdf/050706-1.pdf In re: Election Protest of Bill Fletcher NO. COA05-706 filed 7 February 2006] *[http://www.app.sboe.state.nc.us/NCSBE/Elec/Results/resultsby_contest_summary.asp?ED=11xx02xx2004AGENERAL2004REPUUS%2520SENATE&B1=Submit 2004 GENERAL ELECTION RESULTS] (NC State Board of Elections) *{{cite web |url=http://www.buncombecounty.org/common/election/candidates.pdf |format=PDF |publisher=[[Buncombe County, North Carolina]] |title=2005 election candidates (inferred) |quote=SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION June S. Atkinson PO BOX 31461, RALEIGH, NC 27622 DEM Bill Fletcher POB 5614, CARY, NC 27512 REP}} *[http://www.edweek.org/login.html?source=http://www.edweek.org/ew/articles/2005/02/16/23caps-1.h24.html&destination=http://www.edweek.org/ew/articles/2005/02/16/23caps-1.h24.html&levelId=2100 Education Week: N.C. High Court Upends Chiefâ€™s Race] February 16, 2005 Fee. *[http://www.carolinajournal.com/exclusives/display_exclusive.html?id=2215 Makings of a Constitutional Crisis, By John Hood, February 18, 2005, Carolina Journal online.] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Fletcher, Bill | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fletcher, Bill}} [[Category:North Carolina Republicans]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
